abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Secondary Education Enhancement Project (SEEP) for Egypt is
            to establish the basis for an equitable education system by
            improving the quality and opportunity in secondary education
            through: a) increasing access to general secondary education
            through upgrading commercial schools to technological
            general schools and providing flexible options for study
            within and between branches of the system; b) better
            aligning curricula and assessment with the skills needs of
            employers and higher education; c) providing professional
            development for teachers and administrators on new
            technologies, curricula, assessment and management
            techniques; and d) by strengthening institutional capacity.
            This restructuring paper seeks the approval of the Regional
            Vice President (RVP) to extend the closing date of the
            project by four months from June 30, 2012 until October 31,
            2012. The SEEP was presented to the Board on April 15, 1999.
            The credit agreement was signed on April 19, 1999 but only
            became effective on June 29, 2000. The change is in response
            to a request from the Government of the Arab Republic of
            Egypt to extend the closing date from June 30, 2012 to
            October 31, 2012. If granted this will be the fourth closing
            date extension for this project. The extension is necessary
            to complete the rehabilitation of additional 67 schools
            during the summer so they can meet minimum quality
            requirements for accreditation and thus help achieve the
            project's quality of education objectives.
